alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 12 at 10:15PM EST until January 13 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 8 to 20 inches, greatest over the higher terrain from Ishpeming to Negaunee into Sands Township. The lesser amounts of snow will be right along the Lake Superior shoreline, including Marquette City. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Marquette County. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blizzard conditions continue tonight through Saturday morning, then winds slowly fall back through the day Saturday. As system snowfall comes to an end Saturday, expect lake enhanced snowfall to continue the rest of Saturday into Saturday night.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
